Looking for some alternative classes for Dungeon World<br />        So I&#39;m wondering what cool classes outside of the core exist. My definition of cool includes a flavorful character, not just &quot;he&#39;s a fighter that only uses garden tools&quot;. Also the character needs to be well balanced compared with all the others. The final part of cool is free (okay, that&#39;s more frugal than cool).
<div id='comment z12hj3jqtnrjunwo204ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/111339504073837053815_photo.jpg'> Ross “Hawklord2112” Kingston</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-02 10:33:37 (edited: 2017-08-02 10:33:37)</cite></p>
        <p>The biomancer. Fae</p>
</div>

        <p>Also there&#39;s a Witch class on DTRPG that&#39;s lovely</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12hj3jqtnrjunwo204ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/116013665970125878211_photo.jpg'> Yochai Gal</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-02 11:36:45 (edited: 2017-08-02 11:36:45)</cite></p>
        <p>I humbly submit my playbook, The Binder:<br /><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xy5kiXcNd-oTxbu8KNDWQIyzxLloo99vEzAK-FGv1n4/edit?usp=drivesdk" data-embed="-_-hF1aHR0cHM6Ly9kb2NzLmdvb2dsZS5jb20vZG9jdW1lbnQvZC8xWHk1a2lYY05kLW9UeGJ1OEtORFdRSXl6eExsb285OXZFekFLLUZHdjFuNC9lZGl0P3VzcD1kcml2ZXNkayZfZXNjYXBlZF9mcmFnbWVudF89" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xy5kiXcNd-oTxbu8KNDWQIyzxLloo99vEzAK-FGv1n4/edit?usp=drivesdk</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12hj3jqtnrjunwo204ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/117175341165637840811_photo.jpg'> James Etheridge</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-02 11:45:08 (edited: 2017-08-02 13:52:50)</cite></p>
        <p>There are so many out there that it&#39;s kinda impossible to know what to mention without knowing what kind of character you want to play. Like, my favorite third party class is probably The Princess, but that&#39;s not really helpful if you don&#39;t want to play a character who makes heartfelt speeches, has a powerful nemesis, and is royalty with all that entails.<br /><br />Side note, making the character flavorful is mostly the player&#39;s job, not the playbook&#39;s.<br /><br />As a general suggestion, though: it&#39;s not free, but Class Warfare gives a lot of playbook bang for fifteen bucks. It&#39;s a kit for building playbooks out compendium classes, of which it contains quite a few. There are a few broken combinations, but the results will be balanced unless you go out of your way to make the results not balanced.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12hj3jqtnrjunwo204ccrjjkmn3f3rrlyw0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/114565208078196505939_photo.jpg'> Charles Gatz</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-08-02 14:30:49 (edited: 2017-08-02 14:30:49)</cite></p>
        <p>Keeping it 100, <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/117175341165637840811" oid="117175341165637840811">James Etheridge</a></span> to repeat, &quot;making the character flavorful is mostly the player&#39;s job, not the playbook&#39;s&quot;. I&#39;ve heard nothing but good things about Class Warfare, so if you can afford it, and will get some use out of it, I doubt you&#39;ll regret it. I also just posted this to another thread here: <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/DungeonWorld/comments/3ycr50/complete_list_of_dungeon_world_classes/" data-embed="__6EV1odHRwczovL3d3dy5yZWRkaXQuY29tL3IvRHVuZ2VvbldvcmxkL2NvbW1lbnRzLzN5Y3I1MC9jb21wbGV0ZV9saXN0X29mX2R1bmdlb25fd29ybGRfY2xhc3Nlcy8" data-attachment-render-hint="1" class="ot-anchor">https://www.reddit.com/r/DungeonWorld/comments/3ycr50/complete_list_of_dungeon_world_classes/</a>   I find it useful to at least see what&#39;s out there (even if they&#39;re not all free)</p>
</div>
